definition: to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~

sentences.english: We have listened to Danish and spoken it from childhood. It is the joy of recognition we experience.
sentences.chinese: 我们从小就听说丹麦语，这是我们经历认同感的快乐。

sentences.english: And suppose the soul is the key to personal identity.
sentences.chinese: 假设灵魂就是个人认同感的关键。

sentences.english: He needs also to identify the opponent more clearly and stick with it.
sentences.chinese: 他同时也需要和自己的对手有认同感，并且始终如一。

sentences.english: So follow the body means follow the person.
Movie-goer Fatima seems to share his view.
sentences.chinese: 前去观看影片的法蒂玛与他有同感。

sentences.english: Wang Xuming, former spokesman for the Ministry of Education, feels the same way.
sentences.chinese: 教育部前发言人王旭明也深有同感。

sentences.english: Remember,if you accept the personality theory,follow the personality.
sentences.chinese: 请记住，如果接受人格理论，个人认同感基于人格。

sentences.english: People buy products because they’re looking for recognition.
sentences.chinese: 人们购买产品，因为他们在寻找认同感。

sentences.english: The ignorant princess has little empathy with the businessmen.
sentences.chinese: 无知的公主跟商贾们没甚么同感。

sentences.english: Many feel the same way as Chen.
sentences.chinese: 许多人都跟陈蓉有同感。

sentences.english: Landscape space you have to reach me, I have your sense of identity.
sentences.chinese: 达到景观空间你中有我，我中有你的认同感。

sentences.english: Rewards and recognition are key incentives to encourage people into this new way of working.
sentences.chinese: 奖励和认同感是激励人们在新方法中工作的重要动机。

sentences.english: The Kogi's identification with their culture is phenomenally strong.
sentences.chinese: 科吉人对其文化的认同感非常强烈。
他听到一声颇有同感的叹气声。

sentences.english: Now,the knucklebone theory of personal identity is a very stupid theory.
sentences.chinese: 这个指关节骨的个人认同感理论是愚蠢的。
25岁的法律助理金静也有同感。

definition: to feel as if it had happened to oneself/to sympathize/(polite expression of gratitude for a favor received by a friend etc) I take it as a personal favor
to have to pour out what's on one's mind (idiom)
phonetic a, similar to 呵/-azine, see 吖嗪[a1 qin2]
(lit.) so exhausted (by difficulties in a relationship) that one feels one could never fall in love again (Internet slang)/disenchanted with sth
fellow sufferers empathize with each other (idiom); misery loves company
(coll.) to feel sick at heart/to feel stifled/to feel crushed
